title: PRISTIN former members to debut in new girl band and we’re ready to stan
text:
Eunwoo, Roa, Rena and Yuha will be joining a new group (Picture: Pledis)

PRISTIN fans were heartbroken when the girl group disbanded in May.

But there’s good news, as four of the band’s members are now reforming as a new group.

Eunwoo, Roa, Yuha and Rena will be debuting together in a five-member girl band with Al Seul Bit Entertainment later this year.

It’s the agency’s first girl group, and the four former Pristin members will be joined by one more bandmate who has yet to be announced.

Al Seul Bit said: ‘We are launching a five-member girl group with the goal of a debut sometime in November.

‘The new girl group will include former PRISTIN members Eunwoo, Minkyung [Roa], Kyungwon [Yuha], and Yebin [Rena]. They will be debuting together with a new member who has not yet been revealed to the public. We ask that you show a lot of anticipation [for their debut].’

Advertisement

Advertisement

Eunwoo, Rena, Roa and Yiha have known each other since 2016, when they competed on Mnet’s Produce 101, and debuted together in Pristin alongside Nayoung, Xiyeon, Kula, Kyulkyung, Yehana and Sungyeon in 2017.

Pristin, previously known as Pledis Girlz, had success with their singles Wee Woo, Black Widow and We Like, and released two EPs – Hi! Pristin and Schxxl Out.

However, earlier this year it was confirmed Pristin were disbanding after Nayoung, Roa, Yuha, Eunwoo, Rena, Xiyeon and Kyla terminated their contracts with Pledis.

Kyulkyung, Yehana and Sungyeon have stayed with the agency.

description: PRISTIN's former members Eunwoo, Rena, Roa and Yuha are set to debut in a new girl band.
